Govee device commands

Imports

private/consts, errors, types

Procs

proc getBrightness(govee: Govee; device: GoveeDevice): float {....raises: [
    Exception, LibraryError, SslError, IOError, OSError, KeyError, ValueError,
    HttpRequestError, TimeoutError, ProtocolError, JsonParsingError, GoveeError], tags: [
    RootEffect, ReadDirEffect, ReadEnvEffect, ReadIOEffect, WriteIOEffect,
    TimeEffect].}
Returns device's brightness as a percentage (e.g. 56% brightness is 0.56)
Warning: This may return 0, as the device may not support retriving brightness
proc getColor(govee: Govee; device: GoveeDevice): Color {....raises: [Exception,
    LibraryError, SslError, IOError, OSError, KeyError, ValueError,
    HttpRequestError, TimeoutError, ProtocolError, JsonParsingError, GoveeError], tags: [
    RootEffect, ReadDirEffect, ReadEnvEffect, ReadIOEffect, WriteIOEffect,
    TimeEffect].}
Get device's color
Warning: This may return a blank color (#000000). This is because the API sometimes does not provide the device's color.
proc getColorTemp(govee: Govee; device: GoveeDevice): int {....raises: [Exception,
    LibraryError, SslError, IOError, OSError, KeyError, ValueError,
    HttpRequestError, TimeoutError, ProtocolError, JsonParsingError, GoveeError], tags: [
    RootEffect, ReadDirEffect, ReadEnvEffect, ReadIOEffect, WriteIOEffect,
    TimeEffect].}
Returns device's color temperature in kelvin
Warning: This may return 0K. This is because the API sometimes does not provide the device's color temperature.
proc getInfo(govee: Govee; device: GoveeDevice): tuple[online, powerState: bool,
    brightness, colorTemp: int, color: Color] {....raises: [Exception,
    LibraryError, SslError, IOError, OSError, KeyError, ValueError,
    HttpRequestError, TimeoutError, ProtocolError, JsonParsingError, GoveeError,
    ValueError], tags: [RootEffect, ReadDirEffect, ReadEnvEffect, ReadIOEffect,
                        WriteIOEffect, TimeEffect].}
Get all device information as a tuple.
Warning: brightness, colorTemp, and color may be 0 or a blank color.
proc getPowerState(govee: Govee; device: GoveeDevice): bool {....raises: [
    Exception, LibraryError, SslError, IOError, OSError, KeyError, ValueError,
    HttpRequestError, TimeoutError, ProtocolError, JsonParsingError, GoveeError], tags: [
    RootEffect, ReadDirEffect, ReadEnvEffect, ReadIOEffect, WriteIOEffect,
    TimeEffect].}
Returns the device's power state (i.e. whether the device is on or off) 
proc isOnline(govee: Govee; device: GoveeDevice): bool {....raises: [Exception,
    LibraryError, SslError, IOError, OSError, KeyError, ValueError,
    HttpRequestError, TimeoutError, ProtocolError, JsonParsingError, GoveeError], tags: [
    RootEffect, ReadDirEffect, ReadEnvEffect, ReadIOEffect, WriteIOEffect,
    TimeEffect].}
Returns whether or not the device is online or not
Warning:

Sometimes this may return the wrong state. The Govee API docs state:

"'online' is implemented through the cache. Sometimes it may return wrong state. We suggest the third-party developers to ensure that even if online returns 'false', the users are allowed to send control commands, then even if there the cache is wrong, the users can still control the device."

proc setBrightness(govee: Govee; device: GoveeDevice; brightness: float) {....raises: [
    Exception, LibraryError, SslError, IOError, OSError, KeyError, ValueError,
    HttpRequestError, TimeoutError, ProtocolError, JsonParsingError, GoveeError], tags: [
    RootEffect, ReadDirEffect, ReadEnvEffect, ReadIOEffect, WriteIOEffect,
    TimeEffect].}
Sets devices's brightness to brightness.
Note: brightness is a percentage (e.g. 73% brightness is 0.73)
proc setColor(govee: Govee; device: GoveeDevice; color: Color) {....raises: [
    Exception, LibraryError, SslError, IOError, OSError, KeyError, ValueError,
    HttpRequestError, TimeoutError, ProtocolError, JsonParsingError, GoveeError], tags: [
    RootEffect, ReadDirEffect, ReadEnvEffect, ReadIOEffect, WriteIOEffect,
    TimeEffect].}
Set device's color to color

    HttpRequestError, TimeoutError, ProtocolError, JsonParsingError, GoveeError], tags: [
    RootEffect, ReadDirEffect, ReadEnvEffect, ReadIOEffect, WriteIOEffect,
    TimeEffect].}
Set device's color temperature to temp in kelvin

    RootEffect, ReadDirEffect, ReadEnvEffect, ReadIOEffect, WriteIOEffect,
    TimeEffect].}
Set device's power state (i.e. whether the device is on or off) to state
